text:
Marie Curie Ave., (Exterior Street), west side, north from and including East 78th Street.
September 25, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
East River, from East 71st (right) to East 68th Street, showing buildings of New York Hospital and Cornell Medical College. Also shown (center) are coal yards of the Trinity Coal Corporation and (left) of the Stokes Coal Co. April 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A portion of the same, at a later date, showing a closer view of the boiler room, laundry and dynamo buildings, and the Trinity Coal Corp. yard. Autumn 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, an extensive view south to East 59th Street, and showing a portion of the Queensborough Bridge. In the left background is visible the Chrysler Building. The vantage point for these three views is Welfare Island.

Autumn 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - shore and skyline ; Queensborough bridge ; Williamsburg bridge.

text:
East River, shoreline, north from East 76th to East 79th Streets, showing (left) the Plaza Coal Corporation's yard, and John Jay Park. August 31, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan between East 76th and 79th Streets - Queensborough Bridge.

text:
East River, shoreline, north from East 73rd to East 78th Streets, showing (left to right) the incinerator of the Department of Sanitation, the power plant of the Interborough Rapid Transit and John Jay Park. The vantage point is Welfare Island.

April 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan between East 73rd and 78th Streets - Queensborough Bridge.
